intro: Agapetes toppinii, commonly known as the silverleaf agapete, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant features small, dark green leaves that are often covered in a silvery or whitish bloom, giving it its common name. It produces bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring. Agapetes toppinii thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests at high elevations.
